Sith

messages.subject: Re:  Entering shyly...
messages.msgSnippet: Hiiiiii... *Glomps* Long time no see!! It s a pleasure to be here and in your company *winks* and thanks for the welcome. see you around Firuze PS: (throwing a
messages.messageBody:
Hiiiiii...
*Glomps* Long time no see!!
It's a pleasure to be here and in your company *winks* and thanks for the welcome.
see you around
Firuze
PS: (throwing a tantrum: I want more "Falling" *pouts then makes puppy eyes* Soon, pretty please? )
----- Original Message -----
From: l_o_sith
To: SHQ@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, March 25, 2004 12:22 AM
Subject: [Norton AntiSpam] [SHQ] Re: Entering shyly...


I signed up for this list and noticed you have posted. Thank you for
telling me about this list, and welcome to Saitoh fandom.

Sith


--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "Firuze" <firuzekhanume2002@y...> wrote:
> Hi...
> I suppose it's time to introduce myself... *fidgets slightly*
> By now, some of you already know that all time RK favorite character
is Enishi, and might wonder what I'm doing here. Hell, I even feel
myself like some kind of intruder... However, I think it's not exactly
a mystery that my second favorite character in the series is Saitou,
and that's why I tend to give him an important role in my fics. So,
well, I find tempting any place where I can find interesting
information as well as to hear interesting discussions about him, his
past and the Shinsengumi. So here I'm.
> Yet, there is a second reason, since I am in love with PMK series.
The guilty party here is composed by Barbara Sheridan and Miss Behavin
*points at both* and their deliciously funny Mibu Times/Dispatch. I
found that to understand certain jokes I had to know about PMK, so I
decided to download several episodes. Since then, I'm lost in
addiction. *wails*
> A wave of sadness enveloped me over the past weekend, after I saw
episode 23, since it announced that next one would be the ending. Is
there any news on any kind of continuation? Is there any place where I
can read/download scanlations/translations of the manga? I live where
the world ends, in deep South America, so you can imagine, no dreams
of getting any copy of the manga at all for a very long time. Any info
will be deeply appreciated.
> Firuze
>
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re:  Entering shyly...
messages.msgSnippet: Hi... ... newspapers and decided to share them is it????? *tries to contain mad laughter* And besides as far as addictions go there are worse ones *cough* soba
messages.messageBody:
Hi...

>It's certainly not *our* fault that we stumbled upon a stack of old
newspapers and decided to share them is it????? *tries to contain mad
laughter* And besides as far as addictions go there are worse ones
*cough* soba *cough*.<

Yeah, I suppose I cannot blame you... *winks*... btw... I want to read more editions of the old newspapers...
As for addictions, sister's ghosts are far worse than soba AND cigarrette together... *sighs*
(talking of which, I don't know if it's fate, or a fixation of dark angsty guys with complicated sibling relationships, but as you can guess by what I said, my fav. PMK character is Yamazaki Susumu...)

>*Sigh* the raw version came out last night and as far as I know that's
the end of that. However iI don't see why they can't give us a couple
extra movies---but please Dear Kami don't let it be anything like the
dreaded RK Seishounen (sp?)>

So it's true... *wails louder than before*
Now, I totally agree with you concerning PMK movies, but I think they know better than to play on us some dirty trick in Seissou Hen style. They know that they risk to be promptly Aku-Soku-Zan-ed on sight if they dare. >.<

Thanks for the tips, I'll try to google during the weekend (free of daughter's school YEAH!)
and concerning that undercover assignments...................... Hehe... I guess Hijikata -sama would be almost as happy as when his haikus were stolen... But Okita looks possitively, absolutely gorgeous...

Now about that Ishin Shishi undercover... red on red..., mmm... too flashy? maybe if he tries magenta next time... He should ask advice to Okita-sama. Hehehe...
Firuze
----- Original Message -----
From: Barbara Sheridan
To: SHQ@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, March 24, 2004 11:33 AM
Subject: [Norton AntiSpam] [SHQ] Re: Entering shyly...




Firuze wrote:

> The guilty party here is composed by Barbara Sheridan and Miss Behavin *points at both* and their deliciously funny Mibu Times/Dispatch. I found that to understand certain jokes I had to know about PMK, so I decided to download several episodes. Since then, I'm lost in addiction. *wails*>>
>

>A wave of sadness enveloped me over the past weekend, after I saw episode 23, since it announced that next one would be the ending. Is there any news on any kind of continuation?>>
>
*Sigh* the raw version came out last night and as far as I know that's
the end of that. However iI don't see why they can't give us a couple
extra movies---but please Dear Kami don't let it be anything like the
dreaded RK Seishounen (sp?)

Is there any place where I can read/download scanlations/translations of
the manga? >>

The first 2 or 3 volumes have been done and I believe it's on
fifay.net You should be able to find it by Googling

And here's a wee something that might cheer you up because it seems that
Hijikata and company were sent on a little undercover assignment....

http://www.shinsengumihq.com/prom.htm

--
Barbara Sheridan
http://www.barbarasheridan.net

messages.subject: Entering shyly...
messages.msgSnippet: Hi... I suppose it s time to introduce myself... *fidgets slightly* By now, some of you already know that all time RK favorite character is Enishi, and might
messages.messageBody:
Hi...
I suppose it's time to introduce myself... *fidgets slightly*
By now, some of you already know that all time RK favorite character is Enishi, and might wonder what I'm doing here. Hell, I even feel myself like some kind of intruder... However, I think it's not exactly a mystery that my second favorite character in the series is Saitou, and that's why I tend to give him an important role in my fics. So, well, I find tempting any place where I can find interesting information as well as to hear interesting discussions about him, his past and the Shinsengumi. So here I'm.
Yet, there is a second reason, since I am in love with PMK series. The guilty party here is composed by Barbara Sheridan and Miss Behavin *points at both* and their deliciously funny Mibu Times/Dispatch. I found that to understand certain jokes I had to know about PMK, so I decided to download several episodes. Since then, I'm lost in addiction. *wails*
A wave of sadness enveloped me over the past weekend, after I saw episode 23, since it announced that next one would be the ending. Is there any news on any kind of continuation? Is there any place where I can read/download scanlations/translations of the manga? I live where the world ends, in deep South America, so you can imagine, no dreams of getting any copy of the manga at all for a very long time. Any info will be deeply appreciated.
Firuze



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
